title: Wand strategy
data:
There are 24 wands in NetHack.

Management of wands is an important part of the game. Some wands are useful early in the game but become nearly useless later. Some wands are frequently carried for immediate use, while others are often kept in [stashes](/wiki/Stash "Stash"). Wands are heavier than rings or scrolls (though only a third the weight of potions), so choices must be made.

Note that all wands have value as [polyfodder](/wiki/Polyfodder "Polyfodder"). Some wands with offensive potential may be picked up simply to keep them out of enemy hands.

Another important consideration with wands is deciding which are worth recharging, as scrolls of charging (and/or magic markers to make them) are typically a scarce resource.

## Wands That Are Always Useful

**[Wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing")**: See the [wand's page](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing") for full details. These wands are always good to have. It's hard to beat getting an item of your choice, and you'll likely end up using a few charges before Gehennom to obtain [rare](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") and [necessary](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") extrinsics. However, there are strategies in which people save a wish for as late as the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane").

**[Wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death")**: A very powerful offensive tool. Particularly valuable as a last-ditch weapon when facing a difficult opponent, or for efficiently dispatching the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") and other endgame threats.

**[Wand of secret door detection](/wiki/Wand_of_secret_door_detection "Wand of secret door detection")**: Often stashed until the [endgame](/wiki/Endgame "Endgame"), when it is useful for finding the secret door in [Moloch's Sanctum](/wiki/Moloch%27s_Sanctum "Moloch's Sanctum") and the portals in the [Elemental Planes](/wiki/Elemental_Planes "Elemental Planes").

**[Wand of digging](/wiki/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging")**: These are the fastest way to cut through rock, which is helpful in some situations, such as the [Plane of Earth](/wiki/Plane_of_Earth "Plane of Earth"), or as an escape item when zapped downwards. A digging tool (such as a [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe")) can do the same things, but is much slower.

**[Wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire")** and **[wand of lightning](/wiki/Wand_of_lightning "Wand of lightning")**: Although useful for their attack potential early on, their real value lies in their ability to burn permanent [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") squares.

**[Wand of teleportation](/wiki/Wand_of_teleportation "Wand of teleportation")**: Useful both as an escape item and for teleporting enemies away. Prized for crowd control. While you can't teleport yourself in no-teleport areas, it can always be zapped at enemies to teleport them.

**[Wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph")**: Since self polymorph is of limited duration (and random without a source of [polymorph control](/wiki/Polymorph_control "Polymorph control")), this wand is useful early on for polymorphing pets or polypiling, and later in order to polyself into a metallivore for [jewelry eating](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry").

**[Wand of cancellation](/wiki/Wand_of_cancellation "Wand of cancellation")**: There are many uses for this wand — see [its page](/wiki/Wand_of_cancellation "Wand of cancellation").

## Wands That Are Useful Early

**[Wand of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking")** and **[wand of magic missile](/wiki/Wand_of_magic_missile "Wand of magic missile")**: The low damage potential of these wands for ranged attacks makes them less useful as the game progresses. Early on, they are worth keeping, especially if you don't have good ranged options. You're likely to find many of these, so the best strategy is to use and drop as they are not worth recharging. Keep in mind that they are likely to miss against monsters with good AC, especially the wand of striking. The wand of striking can also be used to break [boulders](/wiki/Boulders "Boulders").

**[Wand of slow monster](/wiki/Wand_of_slow_monster "Wand of slow monster")**: Early in the game, this wand can be used to cripple fast monsters, allowing you to escape or use [hit and run](/wiki/Hit_and_run "Hit and run") tactics. As monster MR increases later in the game, they become less useful, but still have a niche in that they can disrupt engulfing vortices and [air elementals](/wiki/Air_elemental "Air elemental").

**[Wand of light](/wiki/Wand_of_light "Wand of light")**: Useful in lighting the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines"). Not worth recharging.

**[Wand of create monster](/wiki/Wand_of_create_monster "Wand of create monster")**: When sacrificing repeatedly for a gift, the wand of create monster eliminates the wait for a random monster to come along.

**[Silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver") wand**: Whichever wand type happens to be [made of silver](/wiki/Randomized_appearance#Wands "Randomized appearance") can be wielded as a weapon in the early game before you have sufficient resources to fight [lycanthropes](/wiki/Lycanthropes "Lycanthropes") by more conventional means.

## Wands That Are Useful Through Midgame

**[Wand of sleep](/wiki/Wand_of_sleep "Wand of sleep")**: Eventually monsters you encounter will be too powerful to be bothered by sleep spells, and some monsters are never vulnerable, but from early to midgame, this is a handy part of your ranged toolkit. Probably not worth recharging.

**[Wand of cold](/wiki/Wand_of_cold "Wand of cold")**: Although useful for offensive purposes early on, the wand is useful later for freezing water if no levitation source is available.

## Wands of Limited Utility

**[Wand of enlightenment](/wiki/Wand_of_enlightenment "Wand of enlightenment")**: The usefulness of this wand depends on whether you have an [identification](/wiki/Identification "Identification") source (for ring/amulet identification) and how well you [keep notes](/wiki/Notetaking "Notetaking") on intrinsics you receive. Some players keep this wand in their stash rather than carrying it. Unless you are starved for identification and rely on this wand exclusively for discerning magic items' properties, you are unlikely to need to recharge it.

**[Wand of make invisible](/wiki/Wand_of_make_invisible "Wand of make invisible")**: This is typically a single-use wand: you zap yourself to gain the invisibility intrinsic. Note that zapping pets does not confer a benefit.

**[Wand of undead turning](/wiki/Wand_of_undead_turning "Wand of undead turning")**: This wand's chief value is in reviving corpses, which is useful in limited scenarios, such as bringing back fallen pets or killing a dragon again to try for its [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail").

**[Wand of speed monster](/wiki/Wand_of_speed_monster "Wand of speed monster")**: Zapping yourself (or your pet) with this wand gives you the [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") intrinsic. These tend to be wands used once.

## Wands That Are Usually Polyfodder

**[Wand of opening](/wiki/Wand_of_opening "Wand of opening")**: There are some minor uses such as getting un-[engulfed](/wiki/Engulfed "Engulfed") or removing [punishment](/wiki/Punishment "Punishment") but is otherwise a prime candidate for polyfodder.

**[Wand of locking](/wiki/Wand_of_locking "Wand of locking")**: Can create [doors](/wiki/Door "Door") in empty doorways, which is sometimes useful. Apart from that [skeleton keys](/wiki/Skeleton_key "Skeleton key") are simpler and can be used infinitely.

**[Wand of probing](/wiki/Wand_of_probing "Wand of probing")**: A [stethoscope](/wiki/Stethoscope "Stethoscope") can be used infinitely to obtain the same information, though probing does also reveal the monster's inventory.

**[Wand of nothing](/wiki/Wand_of_nothing "Wand of nothing")**: Only useful as polyfodder.
